title: TVLine Items: Invincible Season 3 Date, Yellowstone Spinoff Casting and More
description: Prime Video will be feeling Invincible early next year, when Robert Kirkman’s comic book series returns for Season 3. The first three episodes of the new season will premiere Thursday, Feb. 6, 2025, with a new installment dropping every Thursday through March 13, meaning there will be no midseason break. Additionally, Prime Video has unveiled […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: 'Invincible' Season 3 sets release date on Prime Video and unveils teaser trailer -- watch now!
text: Prime Video will be feeling Invincible early next year, when Robert Kirkman’s comic book series returns for Season 3. The first three episodes of the new season will premiere Thursday, Feb. 6, 2025, with a new installment dropping every Thursday through March 13, meaning there will be no midseason break. Additionally, Prime Video has unveiled a Burger Mart-inspired teaser trailer, which you can view above. Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * The Yellowstone spinoff series The Madison has added Ben Schnetzer (Y: The Last Man) to its cast as “a salt-of-the-earth and neighborly Montana rancher,” our sister site Variety reports. * Judy Greer (Married) has joined The Last Thing He Told Me Season 2 in an undisclosed recurring role, our sister site Deadline reports. The gig will reunite Greer with her 13 Going on 30 castmate Jennifer Garner, who headlines the Apple TV+ series. * Prime Video has released a trailer for the Indian series Citadel: Honey Bunny, premiering Thursday, Nov. 7: * Paramount+ has released a trailer for Season 3 of Transformers: EarthSpark, which will drop all eight episodes on Friday, Oct. 25: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
Prime Video will be feeling Invincible early next year, when Robert Kirkman’s comic book series returns for Season 3.

The first three episodes of the new season will premiere Thursday, Feb. 6, 2025, with a new installment dropping every Thursday through March 13, meaning there will be no midseason break.

Additionally, Prime Video has unveiled a Burger Mart-inspired teaser trailer, which you can view above.

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* The Yellowstone spinoff series The Madison has added Ben Schnetzer (Y: The Last Man) to its cast as “a salt-of-the-earth and neighborly Montana rancher,” our sister site Variety reports.

* Judy Greer (Married) has joined The Last Thing He Told Me Season 2 in an undisclosed recurring role, our sister site Deadline reports. The gig will reunite Greer with her 13 Going on 30 castmate Jennifer Garner, who headlines the Apple TV+ series.

* Prime Video has released a trailer for the Indian series Citadel: Honey Bunny, premiering Thursday, Nov. 7:

* Paramount+ has released a trailer for Season 3 of Transformers: EarthSpark, which will drop all eight episodes on Friday, Oct. 25:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
